ARABIC: وَبِكُفْرِهِمْ وَقَوْلِهِمْ عَلَىٰ مَرْيَمَ بُهْتَٰنًا عَظِيمًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And on account of their kufr, and their utterance of a monstrous slander against Maryam,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And because they denied and spoke dreadful calumnies of Mary;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and for their going so far in unbelief as uttering against Mary a mighty calumny,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Their hearts were also sealed because of their lack of faith, their gravely slanderous accusation against Mary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And because they disbelieved and slandered Maryam with a tremendous accusation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And because of their disbelief and uttering against Maryam a grave false charge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And for their unbelief and for their having uttered against Marium a grievous calumny.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and for their unbelief, and their uttering against Mary a mighty calumny,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And because of their disbelief and of their speaking against Mary a tremendous calumny;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They denied the truth and uttered a monstrous slander against Mary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And for their blasphemy and for their speaking against Maryam a mighty calumny.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And for their faithlessness, and their uttering a monstrous calumny against Mary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That they rejected Faith; that they uttered against Mary a grave false charge;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And because of their (Jews) disbelief and uttering against Maryam (Mary) a grave false charge (that she has committed illegal sexual intercourse);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Also for their disbelief and their saying about Mary a great calumny,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And for their faithlessness, and their saying against Mary a monstrous slander.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [4:156] And for their disbelief, a second time, in Jesus (the bā’ [of bi-kufrihim, ‘for their disbelief’] is repeated in order to separate it [‘their disbelief’ in Jesus] from what is supplemented to it [‘their utterance against Mary’]) and their uttering against Mary a tremendous calumny, when they accused her of fornication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And because of their disbelief) in Jesus and the Gospel (and of their speaking against Mary a tremendous calumny) the calumny for which We have turned them into swine;
